ccre.util

Class Tokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.util.Tokenizer

  • public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
    A system for grabbing tokens from an input string.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tokenizer()
      Create a new Tokenizer with no current input.

      • acceptAnyChar

        public boolean acceptAnyChar(java.lang.String s)
        If any of the specified characters are next in the input, consume it.
        Parameters:
        s - The characters to accept.
        Returns:
        If any character was consumed.

      • acceptCharIndexed

        public int acceptCharIndexed(java.lang.String s)
        If any specified character is next in the input, consume it and return the index in the parameter string.
        Parameters:
        s - The characters to accept.
        Returns:
        The index is the parameter of the accepted character, or -1 if none.

      • nextInteger

        public int nextInteger()
        Read in the next integer from the stream. If no integer, return zero.
        Returns:
        The next integer.

      • remaining

        public java.lang.String remaining()
        Returns:
        the rest of the input.

      • acceptString

        public boolean acceptString(java.lang.String str)
        If the specified string is next in the stream, consume it.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to accept.
        Returns:
        If the string was consumed.

      • acceptWord

        public java.lang.String acceptWord(char delimit)
        Accept a word up to the specified delimiter (or the end of the string if not found.)
        Parameters:
        delimit - The delimiter to search for.
        Returns:
        The word up to the delimiter.
